Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Eat Less, Live Longer, The Sweet Science of Chocolate and Animal Chefs
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Scientists are exploring longevity by discovering ways to make animals live longer through calorie restriction. Meet chocolate makers who'll explain the elaborate engineering and chemistry behind this tasty treat, and also learn why it's good for your health! And, learn what it takes to come up with nutritious and tasty meals to feed thousands of species at diners at aquariums and zoos.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Climate Change: The World At Tipping Point
Clip.EpisodeSummary: What kind of planet will our children inherit? Meet hydrologists, geologists and marine biologists that are discussing the environmental changes that are taking place and get an in-depth look at what's being done to reverse the trend.

Clip.Title: THE ICEBERG PROJECT
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Engineer Georges Mougin will try a revolutionary approach to bringing water to arid regions in need by towing an iceberg from the coast of Canada across the Atlantic before it melts. Towing and utilizing icebergs for freshwater: could the dream become reality?

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Sun, beaches and holidays re-live the story of a region from secluded romantic bays to urban landscapes where the sea plays a major role.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet and his staff must save a tiny chinchilla that has broken both of his arms and a Labrador puppy that needs a bionic appendage that exactly mirrors his diseased bone to save his life.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Off the eastern coast of Australia lies the Great Barrier Reef - a natural structure so large it stretches for over 1,200 miles and can be seen from outer space. This 6,000 year old underwater empire has been built from as many as 400 different species of coral, and holds some of the world's most iconic animals like clownfish, green sea turtles and barracudas.

Clip.Title: MARTIN CLUNES: A MAN AND HIS DOGS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Take a worldwide journey and we investigate where dogs come from, and why on earth they chose us as friends.

Clip.Title: MARTIN CLUNES: A MAN AND HIS DOGS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Out of over 4,000 mammals, how did dogs earn their spot by our side? Join us on our quest for answers.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join host Tom Cavanagh as he goes behind the scenes to the Smithsonian Tropical Research Institute in Panama to track sloths; search the Panama Canal for clues to the creation of the Panamanian Isthmus; and rise sixteen stories atop the rainforest in a construction crane to do bug research.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the Smithsonian, science and history - and even art and design - are used to help predict the future. Join host Tom Cavanagh as we look at designers who have shaped our future, sneak a peek at museum of the future, and talk to scientists helping to preserve the future of the tropical rainforest.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Meet the deranged serial killers and the determined FBI agents who inspired one of Hollywood's most terrifying thrillers and gave Anthony Hopkins and Jodie Foster the roles of a lifetime. We go behind the scenes at the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit to meet the profilers who became the basis for Harris's characters and to uncover the details of real-life murderers Ed Gein, Ted Bundy, and others.

Clip.Title: PLAY ON JOHN: A LIFE IN MUSIC
Clip.Episode: Play on John: A Life in Music
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Before Bob Dylan and The Band there was John Chohen: the man who saved and celebrated American Folk music.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
